Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  Graph

public class Graph
extends Object

This class will hold the graph that will be made up of nodes, which are Vertex Objects. This graph will have Vertices connected to each other which are edges that go off in the NORTH, SOUTH, EAST WEST directions.

Method Detail

clear

public void clear()

addVertex

public void addVertex(Vertex v)
This method adds a new Vertex to the graph.

Parameters:
v - - Vertex to add to the graph

getClose

public List<Vertex> getClose(Vertex v,
                             Landscape scape)
This method will get Vertices that are positioned close to the input Vertex v. This will return a list of Vertices that will be the Vertices whose positions are either directly vertical +/- 1 unit or directly horizontal +/- 1 unit. The list will not include diagonal neighbors. This method will include wrap arounds if the Vertex v sits on one of the edges of the Landscape.

Parameters:
v - - Vertex with which you want to find the neighbors
scape - - Landscape we are playing on
Returns:
a List of Vertices which are neighbors with v (not including diagonal neighbors).

getVertices

public List<Vertex> getVertices()
This returns a list of the Vertices in the graph

Returns:
list of all the vertices in the graph

vertexCount

public int vertexCount()
This returns the number of Vertices in the graph

Returns:
number of vertices in the graph

addEdge

public void addEdge(Vertex v1,
                    Vertex.Direction dir,
                    Vertex v2)
This method adds v1 and v2 to the graph ( if necessary ) and adds edges connecting v1 to v2 via direction dir and connecting v2 to v1 via the opposite direction

Parameters:
v1 - - Vertex to make a connection to v2 in the direction dir
dir - - direction to make the connection from v1 to v2
v2 - - Vertex to make a connection with to v1 in the opposite direction of dir

getVertex

public Vertex getVertex(int i)
This method will get the vertex at the index i in the list of Vertices, since this is a graph the index i is going to be used to get a random Vertex from the list (i.e. for placement of the Hunter and Wumpus in the game).

If the method of storing the list of vertices is changed from a List to another data structure this method would have to be changed

Parameters:
i - - index of the Vertex to get
Returns:
Vertex at the ith index

setInvisible

public void setInvisible()
This method will set all of the Vertices to not draw themselves

This will set all of the marked data fields to false

setVisible

public void setVisible()
this method will set all of the vertices to draw themselves

This will set all of the marked data fields to true

addEdge

public void addEdge(Vertex v1,
                    Vertex.Direction dir,
                    Vertex v2,
                    Vertex.Direction dir2)
This method adds v1 and v2 to the graph (if necessary) and adds edges connecting v1 to v2 via direction dir and v2 to v1 via direction d2. Note that d1 and d2 need not be opposites.

Parameters:
v1 - - Vertex to add an edge that connects it to v2 in the direction dir
dir - - direction with which to connect v1 to v2
v2 - - Vertex to add an edge to that connects it to v1 in the direction dir2
dir2 - - Direction with which to connect v2 to v1

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
This method will check to see whether the graph is connected. I.e. can every Vertex be reached from every other vertex. It does this by computing the shortestPath algorithm for the first Vertex in the list of vertices. It will then check to see if any of the costs are still at the max value. if they are still at the max value, then it cannot reach the vertex, meaning our graph isn't connected.

Returns:
- true if the graph is connected, false otherwise.

shortestPath

public void shortestPath(Vertex v0)
This method implements a single-source shortest-path algorithm for the Graph. This method finds the cost of the shortest path between v0 and every other connected vertex in the graph, counting edge as having a unit cost except for vertices with type not equal to 0 are not counted as being a place the hunter can stop so they will effectively have an edge weight of 0. This method is modelled off of the Dijkstra's algorithm.

Parameters:
v0 - - Vertex with which to calculate the shortest path length between v0 and every other Vertex it is connected to.

findActualNeighbor

public Vertex findActualNeighbor(Vertex.Direction dir,
                                 Vertex v)
This method will find the neighbor of Vertex v in the direction dir. What is being considered a neighbor here is a Vertex that is of type 0. if the edge of v in the Direction dir is a Vertex of type that is not 0 we will keep moving in the appropriate directions (based on the type of the vertex) until we reach a Vertex that is of type 0 (via recursive calls). This Vertex will be returned.

Parameters:
dir - - Direction of the edge for Vertex v that we want to find the neighbor of
v - - Vertex we are finding the neighbor of
Returns:
- Vertex of type 0 that neighbors v in the direction dir. Null if there is no neighbor

findDir

public Vertex.Direction findDir(int type,
                                Vertex.Direction dir)
This method finds the direction that we need to move in, based on the type of Vertex that we are in and the Direction dir that we entered into a Vertex from.

Parameters:
type - - The type of the vertex you are in
dir - - Direction from which you entered into the Vertex
Returns:
Direction to head out of the Vertex
